official-title.#text:
To authorize the continued use of certain water
		  diversions located on National Forest System land in the Frank Church-River of
		  No Return Wilderness and the Selway-Bitterroot Wilderness in the State of
		  Idaho, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Idaho Wilderness Water Resources
			 Protection Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Treatment of
			 existing water diversions in Frank Church-River of No Return Wilderness and
			 Selway-Bitterroot Wilderness, Idaho

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall issue a
			 special use authorization to the owners of a water storage, transport, or
			 diversion facility (in this section referred to as a

land in the Frank Church-River of No Return
			 Wilderness and the Selway-Bitterroot Wilderness for the continued operation,
			 maintenance, and reconstruction of the facility if the Secretary determines
			 that—

text.#text:
the facility was
			 in existence on the date on which the land upon which the facility is located
			 was designated as part of the National Wilderness Preservation System (in this
			 section referred to as

the owner of the
			 facility holds a valid water right for use of the water on the owner’s
			 non-Federal land under Idaho State law, with a priority date that predates the
			 date of designation; and

it is not
			 practicable or feasible to relocate the facility to land outside of the
			 wilderness and continue the beneficial use of water on the non-Federal land
			 recognized under State law.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Idaho Wilderness Water Resources Protection Act/s:2/ss:a

text.#text:
In a special
			 use authorization issued under

allow use of
			 motorized equipment and mechanized transport for operation, maintenance, or
			 reconstruction of a facility, if the

the
			 use is necessary to allow the facility to continue delivery of water to the
			 non-Federal land for the beneficial uses recognized by the water right held
			 under Idaho State law; and

the
			 use of nonmotorized equipment and nonmechanized transport is impracticable or
			 infeasible; and

preclude use of
			 the facility for the storage, diversion, or transport of water in excess of the
			 water right recognized by the State of Idaho on the date of designation.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Idaho Wilderness Water Resources Protection Act/s:2/ss:a
